findings.title: A01.Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens?
findings.description: _mint function allows minting an unlimited number of sundae tokens.

findings.title: A02.Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The owner has the capability to set fees up to 100% and blacklist addresses, which may lead to potential unauthorized script upgrades.

findings.title: A03.Unprotected function call
findings.description: Unprotected function calls can lead to unauthorized access and potential security breaches.

findings.title: A04.Insecure constructor usage
findings.description: Insecure usage of constructors can lead to unintended behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: A05.Unvalidated user input
findings.description: Unvalidated user input can lead to potential security risks and vulnerabilities.

findings.title: A06.Use of outdated compiler version
findings.description: The contract uses an outdated Solidity compiler version which may lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: A07.Weak randomness in token generation
findings.description: The token generation process lacks sufficient randomness, potentially leading to predictable and exploitable tokens.

findings.title: A09.Lack of access control
findings.description: The contract allows certain functions to be called by anyone, including unauthorized users.

findings.title: Unprotected use of transfer function
findings.description: The return value of an external transfer/transferFrom is not checked, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: A12.Insecure usage of ERC20 interface
findings.description: Insecure usage of ERC20 interface can lead to unauthorized token transfers or other malicious activities.
